abstract: Nine months after they scrapped a $19.5 billion tie-up, the Anglo-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto and Chinalco of China reached a deal Friday to jointly develop an iron ore project in the West African country of Guinea.
snippet: Nine months after they scrapped a $19.5 billion tie-up, the Anglo-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto and Chinalco of China reached a deal Friday to jointly develop an iron ore project in the West African country of Guinea.
lead_paragraph: If you can’t buy them, join them.

headline.main: Chinalco and Rio Tinto Team Up for Guinea Ore

abstract: A judge in Australia denied JPMorgan Chase $28.6 million of fees it claimed for defending a company from a takeover that turned into a bidding war. But the implied logic — that advisers should get paid for what they did, not for what eventually happened — is fuzzy, Reuters Breakingviews argues.
snippet: A judge in Australia denied JPMorgan Chase $28.6 million of fees it claimed for defending a company from a takeover that turned into a bidding war. But the implied logic — that advisers should get paid for what they did, not for what eventually ha...
lead_paragraph: Imagine a world where bankers are paid according to their actual efforts.

headline.main: Judge Denies JPMorgan $28 Million in Fees
